item.description:
We will explore some of 491 acres, laced by footpaths and former logging roads that meander through woods and wetlands and ramble up to the top of 435-foot Cedar Hill.

The trails wind through a varied terrain, offering both flat and inclined trails. There are trials through rock outcroppings (one goes by an interesting glacial boulder called Whale Rock which gives off the effect of a whale breaching land) and by and over a pond. The reservation has in fact five man-made ponds, which on the last two visits there rewarded us with a sighting of a Great Blue Heron. Some trails are short, some flat that tour wetlands, while there is a Pond Trail, with its long, narrow footbridge, that allows you to pause and take in a vista while looking at water lilies, fish, frogs, dragon flies etc.

Birds, bugs, fish, snakes, turtles and frogs were witnessed on last two visits. Fishing is allowed but we won't stop too long for that. If you want you can bring your pole and try your luck or hang back and fish after our visit.

There is a ice cream/snack shack called Bubbling Brook Farms on the road to Rocky Woods where we can stop afterward for refreshments.

If there is a ranger there you may have to pay a fee: Adult $4, Child (12 and under) FREE. Fees collected by ranger on weekends and holidays; honor system applies at all other times. The last two times I was there the ranger was not present.

DIRECTIONS:
Rocky Woods
Hartford Street
Medfield, MA

From I-95/Rt. 128 Exit 16B: Take Rt. 109 West for 5.7 mi. Turn right onto Hartford St. and follow for 0.6 mi. to entrance and parking (100 cars) on left. From intersection of Rts. 27 and 109 in Medfield: Take Rt. 109 East and bear left onto Hartford St. Continue as above.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for a old black Lincoln Continental.
item.name: Rocky Woods Medfield MA
